projects.title: Tableau: Function First
projects.description: My entrance to data analytics really started with Tableau and data visualization. The data wrangling, scraping, cleaning etc. skills have been developed to complement my desire to build functional dashboards that allow folks to make data-supported decisions. I quickly learned that if I wanted to build the best dashboards then I wanted to have the skills to get the data in the best possible shape to do so. This approach has given me a deep appreciation for the advanced capabilities of Tableau, and why I take a functional-first approach to Tableau. You will find my profile mostly contains dashboards that are used to demonstrate functionality and/or are used to complement various Tableau tutorials and workshops. üì∏ Photo by Carlos Muza on Unsplash.

projects.title: Automating with REST APIs
projects.description: Institutional learning management sytems (LMS) don't always 'do' what we need it to, or make data available in an accessible way. Embedded within a team of instructional support staff, we developed a series of tools using the available APIs (REST and GraphQL) to extend the functionality of the LMS. üì∏ Photo by Barn Images on Unsplash.

projects.title: The ‚ÄúIKEA Model‚Äù for pragmatic development of a custom learning analytics dashboard
projects.description: I completed UBC's Master of Education program in 2022. Fondly known as the MET program, the mix of hands-on and theoretical learning ultimately produced a body of work that showcases my desire to learn by doing. A culminating aspect of the program was a project-based course that I was able to continue as a collaboration past graduation, which led to publication of the project in 2023. üì∏ Photo by Susan Q Yin on Unsplash

projects.title: Check out my Master's portfolio
projects.description: I completed UBC's Master of Education program in 2022. Fondly known as the MET program, the mix of hands-on and theoretical learning ultimately produced a body of work that showcases my desire to learn by doing. The goal was to 'show off' artifacts I built throughout the program, but I wanted to do so in a way that allowed me to experiment with new technologies - enter my first experience with Gatsby and React! [Sadly, not mobile friendly]. üì∏ Photo by Susan Q Yin on Unsplash
